x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Many community health centers and emergency units struggle to triage patients quickly, provide accurate first-level guidance, and route them to the right medical team.
Common health issues like flu, malaria symptoms, or minor injuries could be managed more efficiently if patients and frontline staff received intelligent guidance before a medical professional intervenes. Manual triage processes slow down response times and can lead to resource strain during peak periods. There’s a need for a smart, AI-assisted triage and routing system that accelerates care delivery, improves patient experience, and supports medical teams.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Now Assist for Intelligent conversation, summarization, and triage guidance
  • AI Agents for the automated triage, symptom guidance, and suggested actions
  • Flow Designer for automatic routing to appropriate medical teams or services 
  • Record Producer to capture the health-related requests
  • UI Policies & Client Scripts for the dynamic form experiences based on symptoms
  • Notifications for email/sms alerts for patients and health workers
  • Reporting & Dashboards for case monitoring and symptom tracking
  • Performance Analytics to measure response time, track common conditions, and detect critical alerts

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Now assist capabilities enabled on the instance
  • Health-related knowledge base content for AI reference
  • Optional integrations with messaging platforms
  • Basic Flow Designer configuration for routing logic

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Defining clear triage categories and escalation workflows
  • Properly training AI Agents with relevant medical knowledge base content
  • Balancing automation with timely human intervention for critical cases
